7.t: the torment of your Lord will inevitably take place

8.t: and no one will be able to prevent it.

9.t: On the day when the heavens will swiftly fly

11.t: Woe will be to those who rejected the Truth

12.t: and who indulged in false disputes against (God's revelations).

13.t: On that day they will be violently pushed into the fire
13.tr: Yawma yuda'-'oona ilaa naari jahannama da'-'aa

14.t: and they will be told, "This is the fire which you called a lie.
14.tr: Haazihin naarul latee kuntum bihaa tukazziboon

15.t: Is it magic or do you not still see?
15.tr: Afasihrun haazaaaa am antum laa tubsiroon

16.t: Burn in its heat. It is all the same for you whether you exercise patience or not; This is the recompense for your deeds".
16.tr: Islawhaa fasbirooo aw laa tasbiroo sawaaa'un 'alaikum innamaa tujzawna maa kuntum ta'maloon

17.t: The pious will live in bountiful Paradise,

18.t: talking of what they have received from their Lord and of how their Lord has saved them from the torment of hell.
18.tr: Faakiheena bimaaa aataahum rabbuhum Wa-waqaahum rabbuhum 'azaabal jaheem

19.t: They will be told, "Eat and drink to your heart's delight for what you have done".
19.tr: Kuloo washraboo haneee-'am bimaa kuntum ta'maloon

20.t: They will recline on couches arranged in rows and We shall couple them with maidens with large, lovely eyes.

21.t: The offspring of the believers will also follow them to Paradise. So shall We join their offspring to them because of their faith. We shall reduce nothing from their deeds. Everyone will be responsible for his own actions.
21.tr: Wallazeena aamanoo wattaba'at-hum zurriyyatuhum bieemaanin alhaqnaa bihim zurriyyatahum Wa-maaa alatnaahum min 'amalihim min shai'; kullum ri'im bimaa kasaba raheen

22.t: We shall provide them with fruits and the meat of the kind which they desire.

23.t: They will pass cups of un-intoxicating and unsinful wine to one another.
23.tr: Yatanaaza'oona feehaa kaasal laa laghwun feehaa Wa-laa taaseem

24.t: They will be served by youths who will be as beautiful as pearls.
24.tr: Wa-yatoofu 'alaihim ghilmaanul lahum ka-annahum lu'lu'um maknoon

25.t: They will turn to one another ask questions,

26.t: saying, "We were afraid while in the world.
26.tr: Qaalooo innaa kunnaa qablu feee ahlinaa mushfiqeen

27.t: But God has granted us favors and saved us from the scorching heat of the torment.

28.t: We had prayed to Him; He is Kind and All-merciful".
28.tr: Innaa kunnaa min qablu nad'oohu innahoo huwal barrur raheem

29.t: (Muhammad), remind them, by the Grace of your Lord, that you are neither a soothsayer or an insane person.
29.tr: Fazakkir famaaa anta bini'mati rabbika bikaahininw Wa-laa majnoon

30.t: Do they say, "He is only a poet and we are waiting to see him die!?"
30.tr: Am yaqooloona shaa'irun natarabbasu bihee raibal manoon

31.t: Say, "Wait, I too am waiting with you".
31.tr: Qul tarabbasoo fa-innee ma'akum minal mutarabbiseen

32.t: Does their reason tell them to say this or is it because they are a rebellious people?
32.tr: Am taamuruhum ahlaamuhum bihaazaaa am hum qawmun taaghoon

33.t: Do they say, "He has falsely invented it (the Quran)?" In fact, they themselves have no faith.
33.tr: Am yaqooloona taqawwalah; bal laa yu'minoon

34.t: Let them produce a discourse like it if they are true in their claim.
34.tr: Falyaatoo bihadeesim misliheee in kaanoo saadiqeen

35.t: Have they been created from nothing or are they themselves their own creators?
35.tr: Am khuliqoo min ghairi shai'in am humul khaaliqoon

36.t: Have they created the heavens and the earth? In fact, they have no strong faith.
36.tr: Am khalaqus samaawaati wal-ard; bal laa yooqinoon

37.t: Do they own the treasures of your Lord? Have they any authority over God?
37.tr: Am 'indahum khazaaa'inu rabbika am humul musaitiroon

38.t: Do they have a ladder (by which they can climb up to the heavens) and listen (to the angels) and come back to the rest of the people with clear authority?
38.tr: Am lahum sullamuien yastami'oona feehi falyaati mustami'uhum bisultaanim mubeen

39.t: Do the daughters belong to Him and the sons to you?

40.t: Do you (Muhammad) ask them for any payment (for your preaching) which they cannot afford?
40.tr: Am tas'aluhum ajran fahum mim maghramim musqaloon

41.t: Do they have knowledge of the unseen, thus, are able to predict (the future)?

42.t: Do they design evil plans? The disbelievers themselves will be snared by their evil plots.
42.tr: Am yureedoona kaidan fallazeena kafaroo humul makeedoon

43.t: Do they have another god besides God? God is too exalted to be considered equal to the idols.
43.tr: Am lahum ilaahun ghairul laa; subhaanal laahi 'ammaa yushrikoon

44.t: Even if they were to see a part of the heavens falling down upon them, they would say, "It is only dense cloud".
44.tr: Wa-ien yaraw kisfam minas samaaa'i saaqitaien yaqooloo sahaabum markoom

45.t: So leave them alone until they face the day when they will be struck dead from terror
45.tr: Fazarhum hatta yulaaqoo yawmahumul lazee feehi yus'aqoon

46.t: and when their evil plans will be of no benefit to them nor will they be helped.
46.tr: Yawma laa yughnee 'anhum kaidumhum shai'anw Wa-laa hum yunsaroon

47.t: The unjust will suffer other torments besides this but most of them do not know.
47.tr: Wa-inna lillazeena zalamoo 'azaaban doona zalika Wa-laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon

48.t: Wait patiently for the command of your Lord. We are watching over you. Glorify your Lord when you rise during the night
48.tr: Wasbir lihukmi rabbika fa-innaka bi-a'yuninaa Wa-sabbih bihamdi rabbika heena taqoom

49.t: and glorify Him after the setting of the stars.
